October 22, 195k
Dear Harry:
My sincere regrets for the delay in answering your memo of September 2l*, re¬
garding recommendations for future NAEB radio programs. I thought perhaps we
could devote a portion of our Region IV meeting to a discussion of this two
weeks ago. Failing in that, however, I do have a number of recommendations
projected from our experience here at WOI.
To tackle the most difficult area first, I would like to see more quality drama
offered to the network. Specifically, I have in mind something of the quality
and stature of the BBC World Theater, but of 30 minute duration. These could
be complete unrelated plays, such as dramatization of short stories, or seri¬
alized productions of longer works. What they must definitely not be, however,
is "amateur radio drama."
In the area of histoiy on the adult level, I think of several approaches. I
would welcome series in both American and European histoiy and I think particu¬
larly appropriate at this time, the history of Russia. On a more specialized
level, the history of American industry and the histoiy of labor in America
would also be desirable and acceptable.
